title: How could I start speed reading at 1000 wpm in a month of training? - Quora

response.answer_text: As much as I hate to say it, You Can't.  Anyone claiming to read at such speed is either genetically gifted or lying. The maximum that one can reach is around 550 wpm. There are some limitations of the human eye which restrict humans from exceeding this speed.  I read around 480 wpm that too when I know the underlying concepts well. If it is my first read (a topic I have very little knowledge of) then my speed can go to as low as 300 wpm. Also, I developed this skill after some years.  So, you might want to reconsider your target time frame and target speed. I suggest you start with a variety of different topics and read at a slightly higher pace (~275 wpm). Once you get a hang of the basic structure of different topics, you can up the speed. Example, read the basics about micro and macro economics at ~275 wpm. After understanding the basics, when you go on to read advanced stuff, you should be able to read faster and comprehend better.

Well speed reading is a concept thought by many to be magical but as a matter of fact a speed reading champion reads at about 4500 wpm.Originally i came here to find answers myself to increase my reading speed which is currently 550 wpm. There are are three basic concepts in speed reading. your eye movemementshow you comprehend the textmemorizing the textAn average person reads about 200 wpm ,a college student at an average of 400 wpm and a professor at 600 wpm.First of all if you are hoping that you will some how download this information and go from 150 wpm–4500 wpm in a day that just does not happen. So first thing is to know where you stand,you have to calculate your reading speed first. Take a book and a timer and read for one minute and count the number of words you have read in one minute this is your reading speed , the other alternative is to check out some speed reading apps

I'd suggest you look into the debate of whether speed reading is as effective as some companies purport. Despite speed reading programs being described as pseudoscientific, Lifehacker points out that 1000wpm is actually possible.
